title: Suspension of former CID Additional DG N. Sanjay extended by six months

title: Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri meets U.S. Under Secretary Jeffrey Kessler in Washington
content: The Indian Embassy in Washington said Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri met U.S. Under Secretary Jeffrey Kessler to advance cooperation in critical and emerging technologies

title: Farmers of the sea: India‚Äôs dugongs must stay a conservation priority
content: Once widespread in Indian waters, dugong numbers have fallen to an estimated 200 individuals, with both their population and geographic range on the wane

content: Contributions include sponsoring the education of affected children, skill development for adults, and monthly assistance until families achieve self-sufficiency

title: All-party delegation led by MP Kanimozhi arrives in Greece
content: The delegation reached Athens from Slovenia, where it called on senior officials and emphasised India's "new normal" of zero tolerance against cross-border terrorism

title: INDIA bloc to seek special session on Pahalgam attack

title: WB government to start fresh recruitment as well as push for review petition before SC simultaneously, says Mamata
content: Fresh hiring for over 44,000 posts is set to begin by May 30 as directed by apex court, while parallel review will be sought for over 25,000 whose appointments were cancelled over ‚Äòtainted‚Äô selection.

content: Reiterating that there was no need for panic, Dr. T.S. Selvavinayagam says if any one has displays symptoms, especially persons with co-morbidities or the elderly, immediate medical help must be sought at hospitals

title: BSF‚Äôs border management system shows encouraging results during Operation Sindoor: IG Shashank Anand
content: Fencing with sensors allows real-time monitoring in tough terrain, says IG; will work to improve limitations in the counter-drone system, as this is a major challenge during Operation Sindoor, says DIG

title: ‚ÄòMane Manege Police‚Äô initiative to bridge the gap between the force and citizens
content: Parameshwara says the beat police will visit houses, interact with people and help resolve the issues being faced by them

title: Satellite Pics: Did India Target Underground Facility At Pak's Murid Air Base?
content: New high-resolution satellite images, accessed by NDTV, show extensive damage to the Murid air base of Pakistan, showing a three-metre-wide crater just 30 metres from an underground facility of the Pakistan Air Force.

title: Elon Musk's Megarocket Fails, Starship Crashes After Its Farthest Flight
content: Starship, the futuristic SpaceX rocket vehicle on which Elon Musk's ambitions for multiplanetary travel are riding, roared into space from Texas on Tuesday on its ninth uncrewed test launch.

title: Operation Sindoor Must Go Global: Indian Delegation In South Africa
content: NCP-SCP MP Supriya Sule, who is leading an all-party delegation, while interacting with the Indian community in Johannesburg, said the terror attack in Pahalgam has deeply hurt every Indian around the world.

title: In Haryana, Over 1,700 Abortion Kits Seized, 6 FIRs Filed After Raids
content: Authorities in Haryana has seized 1,787 Medical Termination of Pregnancy (MTP) kits during statewide inspections carried out last week to check their illegal sale, and registered six FIRs in this regard, an official statement said here on Tuesday.

title: Video: Chaotic Scenes In Gaza As Thousands Rush Into Israeli Aid Centre
content: Thousands of Palestinians rushed into a new aid distribution centre run by a US-backed group in southern Gaza on Tuesday, AFP journalists reported, leading to chaotic scenes as Israel implemented a new distribution system.

title: Chennai Joyride Malfunction Strands 30 Mid-Air, Sky Lifts To The Rescue
content: At least 30 persons were stranded mid-air when an amusement park ride near Chennai got immobilised due to a technical glitch.

title: King Charles Praises "Strong, Free" Canada Amid Trump's Annexation Threats
content: King Charles III hailed Canada as a "strong and free" nation in a major speech at the opening of parliament in Ottawa amid annexation threats from US President Donald Trump.

title: Video: Mushroom Cloud Over China Chemical Plant After Massive Explosion
content: A large explosion at a chemical plant in eastern China on Tuesday caused giant plumes of smoke to rise from the building, state media said, with no casualties immediately reported.

title: Muslim Australian Lawmaker Says She Was Urged To Drink, "Dance On Table"
content: A Muslim lawmaker in Australia said Wednesday that she has complained to a parliamentary watchdog after a male colleague allegedly urged her to drink wine and "dance on the table".

title: UP Man Kills 65-Year-Old Woman For Denying Sex: Cops
content: A 45-year-old man was arrested and sent to jail on Tuesday for allegedly strangling his elderly romantic partner who refused to engage in physical relation with him, police said.

title: Hajj Pilgrimage To Begin On June 4
content: Saudi Arabia announced on Tuesday that the annual Muslim hajj pilgrimage to Mecca would begin on June 4 after astronomical observatories spotted the crescent moon, marking the start of the lunar month.

title: UP Court Dismisses Plea Against Rahul Gandhi Over Remarks On Lord Ram
content: An MP-MLA court here on Tuesday dismissed a petition filed against Congress leader Rahul Gandhi over his alleged remarks on Lord Ram during a speech at a US university last month.

title: Moscow Airports Disrupted As Russia Says Ukraine Launches Drone Assault
content: Russian authorities said they had battled a major Ukrainian drone attack late Tuesday and early Wednesday, with at least two Moscow airports forced to suspend flights.

title: Centre Likely To Bring Impeachment Motion Against Justice Yashwant Verma
content: The Union government is weighing the option of bringing in Parliament an impeachment motion against Allahabad High Court judge Yashwant Varma.

title: Trump Says 'Golden Dome' Free For Canada If It Joins As 51st US State
content: President Donald Trump said Tuesday that Canada could join his proposed "Golden Dome" missile defense system for free -- but only if it becomes part of the United States.

title: "After Losing Wars, Pak Chose Terrorism To Target India": Indian Delegation In Congo
content: BJP leader SS Ahluwalia, part of the all-party delegation led by Shiv Sena MP Shrikant Shinde, scathingly criticised Pakistan, stating that it has repeatedly used terrorism as a weapon against India after losing three wars.

title: 4 Of Family Killed As Auto-Rickshaw Collides With Bus In UP: Cops
content: Four members of a family were killed after their auto rickshaw was hit by a government bus here on Tuesday evening, police said.

title: Bangladesh Islamist Leader On Death Row For 1971 War Crimes Acquitted
content: Bangladesh's Supreme Court on Tuesday acquitted a senior Jamaat-e-Islami leader, overturning his death sentence by the International Crimes Tribunal (ICT) in a war crimes case related to the 1971 Liberation War against Pakistan.

title: Hindu Group Leader Arrested For Provocative Remarks In Karnataka
content: Mangaluru police on Tuesday arrested Vishwa Hindu Parishad leader Sharan Pumpwell for allegedly making provocative remarks and inciting unrest following the murder of Hindutva activist Suhas Shetty earlier this month, officials said.

title: Delhi Announces Pensions For People Jailed During Emergency
content: The BJP government in Delhi will provide pensions to those who were political prisoners during the Emergency and felicitate them, Chief Minister Rekha Gupta said on Tuesday.

title: BSF foils Bangladeshi nationals‚Äô bid to enter India
content: The incident took place in western Assam during the reported deportation of 14 Bangladeshi nationals who were staying in India illegally

title: Applications for arts and science colleges to be open till May 30
content: The merit list for special category students will be released on May 29, and the one for general category students will be out on May 30

title: Varanasi court rejects plea against Rahul over his remarks on Lord Ram in U.S.
content: Plea accused Cong. leader of referring to Lord Ram as a ‚Äúmythological and fictional character,‚Äù and said the same had  hurt the religious sentiments of Hindus

title: Check dams, causeway across Kaundinya river in Vellore inaugurated
content: The two check dams are expected to boost irrigation and recharge groundwater. Residents say the bridge puts an end to their ordeal of having to take a detour of at least 20 km to reach key towns

title: CBI gets published Interpol Silver Notices against two fugitives
content: Silver Notice was launched in January 2025 as part of a pilot involving 51 countries and territories. The new colour-coded notice enables sharing of alerts and requests for information on assets of wanted criminals

title: NHRC notice to Haryana over journalist‚Äôs murder
content: The journalist was working with an online news portal and was out for a walk after dinner when unidentified assailants shot him and fled from the spot on May 18, 2025

content: A team from the National Institute of Mountaineering and Adventure Sports in Arunachal Pradesh scaled the world‚Äôs third-highest peak on May 18 from the Nepal side

content: Info, photos shared with Pakistani handlers still on arrested ASI‚Äôs phone, says source; his last posting was in Pahalgam; he was approached on social media, received about ‚Çπ3,000 per month from foreign account

content: Draft law, placed on Department of Land Resources‚Äô website for public feedback, aims for greater accessibility with plain language and transparent procedures for citizens, as well as online registration

title: DRUCC members seek more passenger amenities, extension of trains
content: Introduction of new trains and additional train stoppages in Guntur division were among the matters discussed in the meeting

title: A show that spotlights the¬†pomological diversity of Tamil Nadu for 65 years
content:
Three major shows organised as part of the summer festival in the¬†Nilgiris every year ‚Äî the flower show, the vegetable show, and the fruit show ‚Äî were held¬†as a single event when the first flower show was conducted in the late 1800s. Only recently did the fruit show move to the¬†Sims Park in¬†Coonoor, drawing¬†
lakhs of tourists every year

title: Kerala HC enhances compensation for young road accident victim to ‚Çπ53 lakh
content: Sumisha of Thrissur, now aged 26, was only seven years old when she met with an accident in 2006 and has since been living in an orphanage

content: He terms UDF‚Äôs offer to billet him as an ‚Äúassociate member‚Äù in the alliance as amorphous, says TMC reserves the right to recalibrate the party‚Äôs political tack in Nilambur bypoll.¬†Satheesan says UDF‚Äôs reciprocation will hinge on Anvar‚Äôs cooperation

content: Out of 11,755 students from four RGUKT campuses who enrolled for 40 courses, 10,773 received certificates, says Registrar

content: Riyadh Criminal Court sentences him to 20 years of rigorous imprisonment; He is likely to be released in December 2026 as he has already completed 19 years in prison

title: State GST department busts spurious diesel network
content: SGST department conducts raids on spurious diesel racket causing tax loss, environmental damage, and possible money laundering activities

title: When¬†Jayalalithaa walked out of the National Development Council meeting
content: On December 27, 2012, Chief Minister¬†Jayalalithaa walked out of the 57th NDC meeting. She was upset that she could not complete her speech,¬†though every Chief Minister was allotted 10 minutes. She accused the Centre of stifling the voice of the Chief Ministers. But the Centre denied that it had discriminated against non-Congress Chief Ministers

title: NBA conference finals takeaways: Pacers go up 3-1 on the Knicks
content: Here's what has stood out from the latest playoff games of the Eastern and Western Conference finals.

title: Haliburton's historic triple-double keys Game 4 win
content: Tyrese Haliburton had 32 points, 15 assists and 12 rebounds without a turnover for a historic playoff triple-double in the Pacers' Game 4 win.

title: Perry, 40, helps Oilers to cusp of Cup Final return
content: Corey Perry scored the tiebreaking goal on a power play in the second period as the Oilers beat the Stars 4-1 Tuesday night to take a 3-1 lead in the Western Conference finals.

title: Bradshaw: Steelers' interest in Rodgers 'a joke'
content: Four-time Super Bowl-winning quarterback Terry Bradshaw, a Steelers legend, isn't a fan of the Pittsburgh's pursuit of Aaron Rodgers, telling an Arkansas radio station on Tuesday that the club's interest in the 41-year-old signal-caller "is just a joke."

title: CFP 5+11 model draws interest from SEC coaches
content: In a pivot from the push for automatic qualifiers in the next iteration of the College Football Playoff, the SEC on Tuesday took a heightened interest in a 16-team model that would include the five highest-ranked conference champions and 11 at-large bids.

title: WNBA can't verify hateful comments toward Reese
content: The WNBA said it was unable to substantiate allegations of "hateful fan comments" directed toward Angel Reese during a game against the Fever.

title: Kemp pleads guilty to assault charge in shooting
content: Former NBA star Shawn Kemp, 55, a six-time NBA All-Star, pleaded guilty to an assault charge Tuesday for shooting at two men inside a vehicle in a Washington state mall parking lot, and he is now due to be sentenced in August in Tacoma, Washington.

content: Which teams passed and which failed to make the grade during the 2024-25 season? Ian Darke has the answers.

content: Wolverhampton Wanderers have given Manchester United permission to conclude a deal for Matheus Cunha, sources told ESPN.

title: LAFC great Vela retires, named club ambassador
content: Former Mexico and LAFC forward Carlos Vela announced his retirement from soccer on Tuesday, with the 36-year-old to become LAFC's first club ambassador.

title: Man faces attempted murder charge in Liverpool
content: A man has been arrested on suspicion of attempted murder after a car collided with pedestrians shortly after Liverpool's Premier League victory parade on Sunday.

title: Pellegrini: Antony wanted 'revenge' after Utd exit
content: Brazilian winger Antony wanted "revenge" when he arrived on loan at Real Betis after struggling to live up to his hefty price tag at Manchester United, Betis head coach Manuel Pellegrini said Tuesday.

title: Bar√ßa phenom Yamal inks new long-term contract
content: Lamine Yamal has agreed a new long-term contract with Barcelona until 2031, the Spanish champions announced on Tuesday.

title: Messi partners with Su√°rez to launch new team
content: Luis Su√°rez and Lionel Messi have been partners on the pitch for several years. Now they're teaming up off it as businessmen.

title: KC Current owners go global, acquire Danish club
content: Kansas City Current owners Angie and Chris Long are expanding their soccer ventures globally with the purchase of Danish club HB K√∏ge.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City eyeing move for Cherki
content: Manchester City are keeping tabs ahead of a possible move for Lyon's Rayan Cherki. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Goodbye Manchester, hello trophies: Nine ex-United stars who won elsewhere in 2024-25
content: Scott McTominay won an MVP prize in Italy, Dean Henderson won the FA Cup with Crystal Palace, and either Jadon Sancho or Antony will win the UEFA Europa Conference League crown this week. Who else cast out by United has thrived this season?

content: Todd Zola outlines the players you should be claiming off the waiver wire and lineup tips for your roster.

title: Emerging Valkyries pickups to stream
content: Veronica Burton and Kayla Thornton highlight some of the top fantasy women's basketball streamers for the week of May 26.

title: Watch: SpaceX‚Äôs Starship spirals uncontrollably as fuel leaks in dramatic footage
content: SpaceX's Starship ninth test flight reached orbit but faced challenges, including a payload bay door malfunction and a fuel tank leak. The Super Heavy booster exploded before splashdown, and the upper-stage vehicle spun uncontrollably due to fuel leaks. Despite these issues and a scrapped engine demonstration, Starship is heading towards the Indian Ocean, but its heat shield's survival is uncertain.

title: Golden dome or $61 billion? Trump gives Canada stark choice
content: Donald Trump suggests Canada become the 51st US state to join the 'Golden Dome' missile defense system for free. Otherwise, it will cost $61 billion. Canada has shown interest in the system. It is seen as vital for North American early warning capabilities. Mark Carney rejects the statehood proposal. The future of the defense system is uncertain without Canada's support.

title: 'Tamil gave birth to Kannada': Kamal Hassan remarks triggers massive row
content: Karnataka BJP President B Y Vijayendra has demanded an apology from actor Kamal Haasan for his remark that ‚ÄúTamil gave birth to Kannada.‚Äù Vijayendra condemned Haasan's statement as disrespectful to Kannadigas and an insult to the Kannada language, emphasising its rich history and significance.

title: OPT students in US face deportation threat over employment data lapse
content: International students in the US on OPT are facing potential deportation due to stricter enforcement of SEVIS reporting rules. ICE is issuing letters threatening termination for those not promptly updating employment information, particularly regarding unemployment days.

title: Google DeepMind CEO 'warns' college students: World you entering will ...
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis predicts AGI within a decade, foreseeing workplace disruption alongside the creation of engaging new jobs. He advises students to immerse themselves in AI technologies, emphasizing adaptability and continuous learning. Hassabis highlights AI, VR, AR, and quantum computing as promising fields, urging students to combine passions with core skills to thrive in the evolving AI-driven landscape.

title: Ugly handshake! Pakistan player‚Äôs shocking gesture towards Indian tennis star
content: India triumphed over Pakistan in the Junior Davis Cup with a 2-0 victory, highlighted by Prkaash Sarran and Tavish Pahwa's singles wins. A video later emerged showing a Pakistani player's unsportsmanlike handshake, contrasting with the Indian player's calm reaction. After initially missing the handshake, the Pakistani player made contact the second time, only to pull away abruptly in a seemingly disrespectful manner.

title: 'Pak repeatedly attack us': Tharoor in Panama says 'India bears pain, grief, wounds and losses'
content: During an all-party parliamentary delegation to Panama, Shashi Tharoor strongly condemned Pakistan's support for terrorism against India. Addressing the Indian community, he highlighted India's shift in counter-terrorism, citing the surgical strikes in Uri and Balakot. Tharoor emphasised India's message of consequences for attackers and defended Operation Sindoor, launched after the Pahalgam attack.

title: Man vandalises bakery in Bengaluru for being denied free cigarette and tea
content: In Krishnamurthy Layout, Appi damaged a bakery after the owner refused free cigarettes and tea. He verbally abused Ramsidh Saifullah, the owner of SG Bakes and Juice. Appi smashed glass containers and threatened the owner. Police suspect Appi was intoxicated. A video of the incident went viral.

title: Trump to Apple: Okay, you go to India but you're not going to sell in US without ...
content: President Trump is pushing Apple to manufacture iPhones in the United States, threatening a 25% tariff on imported products if they continue production in India. Trump expressed his desire for Apple to prioritize domestic manufacturing, even though India has offered tariff-free deals.

title: The plot thickens: Tollywood's ‚ÄòKannappa‚Äô movie footage stolen, Manchu pari‚Äòwar‚Äô hits climax
content: A criminal case of data theft has embroiled Vishnu Manchu's upcoming mythological film 'Kannappa,' produced by Mohan Babu. Film Nagar police are investigating Raghu and Charitha for allegedly possessing a hard drive with unreleased footage. The company suspects a family feud may be linked to the breach, as the duo aren't employees.

title: After Salman Khan, Aditya Roy Kapur faces trespass scare at Mumbai's Bandra flat
content: Gajala Siddiqui, a 47-year-old Dubai resident, was arrested for trespassing into actor Aditya Roy Kapur's Bandra flat. Claiming acquaintance, she arrived with gifts and refused to leave, prompting Kapur's manager to alert the police. Siddiqui persuaded the house help to let her in, but Kapur denied knowing her, leading to her arrest and court appearance.

title: Did Harvard reject Barron Trump? What US first lady Melania Trump said
content: Amidst White House tensions with Ivy League schools, rumors circulated that Barron Trump applied to and was rejected by Harvard University. However, First Lady Melania Trump has firmly denied these claims, stating they are "completely false." Barron is currently a student at New York University's Stern School of Business, where his college experience is acknowledged as unique due to his public profile.

title: Eastern Railway makes a 'national security' request to YouTubers
content: Eastern Railway has banned detailed photography and videography at its stations, citing national security concerns after a YouTuber's arrest for allegedly sharing sensitive information with Pakistani intelligence. Authorities are intensifying surveillance to enforce these restrictions, particularly at key connecting stations, to safeguard critical infrastructure and prevent security compromises. The rules apply across all Eastern Railway sections and divisions.

title: Doors opened to private sector to join race to develop desi 5th-gen fighters
content: India has approved a new model for its indigenous AMCA fighter jet program, opening the door for private firms to bid alongside HAL. This move aims to accelerate development and production, fostering a robust domestic aerospace industry. While HAL is expected to participate, private companies can bid independently or in collaboration, promoting competition.

title: Top stocks to buy or sell: Stock recommendations for today
content: Stock market recommendations: Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers suggests buying ITI Ltd near ‚Çπ304, targeting ‚Çπ370. Minda Corp is a buy near ‚Çπ530, with a short-term target of ‚Çπ600. BLS International shows upside potential, with entries near ‚Çπ410 and a target of ‚Çπ450.

title: Rape accused gets 1-month bail to marry survivor
content: The Orissa High Court granted a 26-year-old rape accused one-month bail to marry the 22-year-old complainant, whom he allegedly raped when she was a minor. The court acknowledged their relationship as consensual, not forced, prior to the case.

title: PM Modi‚Äôs remarks hint India will seek big rethink of IWT terms
content: PM Modi criticized the Indus Waters Treaty (IWT), deeming it prejudicial to India's interests and hindering the utilization of its water share. He highlighted restrictions on dam desilting and sediment clearing, impacting reservoir capacity. Following the Pahalgam massacre, India put the IWT in abeyance, signaling a potential renegotiation of its terms, particularly the dispute settlement mechanism.

title: Meitei protesters lock up CEO, GSI offices in Imphal
content: Protesters in Imphal locked down two central government offices following an incident where a state transport bus was forced to conceal the word "Manipur." This action escalated tensions, leading to demands for an apology from the governor, fueled by concerns over the state's identity.

title: How to use lemongrass to quickly regrow hair on bald patches
content: Lemongrass offers a natural solution for hair regrowth, addressing common concerns like hair loss and bald patches. Packed with essential nutrients, lemongrass combats scalp infections, reduces inflammation, and improves blood circulation. Regular use in oil infusions, tonics, or masks, combined with a healthy lifestyle, can stimulate hair follicles and promote a fuller, healthier head of hair.

title: EXPLAINED: Why Jitesh was adjudged not out despite being outside the crease?
content: In a thrilling IPL 2025 match, a controversial run-out attempt by LSG's Digvesh Rathi against RCB's Jitesh Sharma sparked debate. Rathi's attempt at the non-striker's end was deemed invalid under MCC Law 38.3, as he had completed his bowling action. Despite Rishabh Pant's sporting gesture to withdraw the appeal, the third umpire's review confirmed the decision.

title: Did Deepika clap back at Vanga amidst Spirit controversy: ' I stand by decisions'
content: Amidst controversy surrounding Sandeep Reddy Vanga, Deepika Padukone seemingly addressed the situation with a cryptic message about staying true to oneself during challenges, delivered at a Stockholm event. This follows speculation that Padukone exited Vanga's film 'Spirit,' leading to a pointed social media post from the director accusing an unnamed actor of "dirty PR games.

title: Watch: Kohli, Anushka exchange kisses after RCB's record chase vs LSG
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru clinched a spot in IPL 2025 Qualifier 1, defeating Lucknow Super Giants by six wickets while chasing a target of 228. Virat Kohli's rapid 54 and a crucial partnership between Jitesh Sharma and Mayank Agarwal propelled RCB to victory.

title: Five wounded in shooting at Connecticut mall
content: Five individuals sustained gunshot wounds at the Brass Mill Centre mall in Waterbury, Connecticut, on Tuesday evening following a dispute. Police Chief Fernando Spagnolo stated that the incident, which occurred around 4:40 pm, was not a random act of violence, as the suspected shooter knew the victims. Although no arrests have been made, authorities assure the public that there is no ongoing threat.

title: With 100 SUVs & 10,000 supporters, Brij Bhushan holds 'victory parade'
content: Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, the former WFI chief, declared his vindication after a Delhi court accepted a closure report in a Pocso case against him. Speaking in Ayodhya, where he received a grand welcome, Singh asserted his faith in the judiciary and called for measures to prevent the misuse of sexual harassment laws, emphasizing that truth prevails.

title: Dipika Kakar cancer diagnosis: Gauahar Khan & others send prayers for her recovery
content: Dipika Kakar has revealed her stage 2 liver cancer diagnosis, sharing the heartbreaking news on social media. Her announcement prompted an outpouring of support from industry friends and former co-stars, including Gaurav Khanna, Gauahar Khan, and Avika Gor, who offered prayers and strength. Dipika remains positive and determined to fight the disease with the support of her family and well-wishers.

title: Water overuse is causing land upliftment in South Africa, study suggests
content: A recent study shows that land in South Africa is rising. This rise links to drought and water loss. Earlier, seismic activity was the suspected cause. Researchers now believe reduced water weight causes the land to rebound. Cape Town's drought is a key example. The study highlights unsustainable water usage and inequality.

title: IPL 2025: RCB beat LSG, to face PBKS in Qualifier 1
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) defeated Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in a high-scoring match. LSG scored 227/3, led by Rishabh Pant's century. RCB chased the target, finishing at 231/3. Virat Kohli scored 54, and RCB's captain hit an unbeaten 85. RCB secured a top-two position and will play Punjab Kings in Qualifier 1.

title: Nagpur woman repatriated by Pak could be arrested
content: Sunita Bholeshwar Jamgade, a Nagpur woman, crossed the Line of Control at Kargil and was later repatriated. An Amritsar police registered a zero FIR against her under the Official Secrets Act, suspecting espionage. Authorities plan to investigate her potential involvement and may arrest her. She was in contact with two people in Pakistan and crossed the border to meet them.

title: Omar Abdullah says J&K will build memorial to 26 killed in Baisaran meadow
content: Following the tragic terrorist attack in Baisaran meadow, the J&K government, led by CM Omar Abdullah, has announced the construction of a memorial to honour the 26 victims. Aiming to restore tourist confidence, the cabinet meeting cleared the memorial in Baisaran ‚Äî about 7km from Pahalgam and reachable either on foot or by horse ‚Äî and Omar said he instructed PWD to start work.

title: Habeas corpus for daughter lands man in Pocso soup
content: The Madhya Pradesh high court has ordered a Pocso Act FIR against a man who sought his missing minor daughter's return. The girl, produced in court, accused him of sexual advances and expressed her desire to live with her female friend.

title: How Trump's 'Big Beautiful Bill‚Äô may turn out to be ugly for Indians in US
content: A proposed US bill, dubbed 'The One Big Beautiful Bill,' could impose a 3.5% remittance tax on money transfers from the US to India by 2026, impacting Indian immigrants, including H-1B visa holders and permanent residents. This legislation, awaiting Senate approval, may significantly increase the financial burden on the Indian community, potentially costing them over a billion dollars annually.

title: Witch-hunt, claim RG Kar doctors as some get 'punishment' jobs
content: Three senior resident doctors, prominent in the RG Kar movement, allege punitive postings in Bengal, triggering accusations of government witch-hunting and counselling process violations. Junior doctors, supported by senior medical bodies, plan protests after being denied clarification from officials. The affected doctors claim their preferred postings were altered due to their protest involvement, undermining the transparency of the allocation process.

title: PM 'master distorian', using filmi dialogues to divert attention: Congress
content: Congress has criticized PM Modi, labeling him a "master distorian" for his remarks on Nehru and using "filmi" dialogues amidst the Pahalgam terror attack. The party questioned the failure to apprehend the perpetrators and the silence on Trump's ceasefire claims. Congress claims opposition MPs are effectively conveying India's anti-terrorism stance globally, contrasting it with BJP members allegedly spreading division.

title: Starship spins out of control, breaks up over Indian ocean in SpaceX test
content: SpaceX's Starship mega rocket test faced failure. The upper stage spun out of control and leaked fuel. It made an uncontrolled reentry over the Indian Ocean. Contact was lost mid-flight during the ninth test flight from South Texas. The rocket released dummy Starlink satellites. A fuel leak caused the spacecraft to spin. The rocket likely disintegrated before impact. The mission provided valuable test data despite the setback.

title: Government proposes online registration of property, documents
content: The central government has drafted a bill to replace the 117-year-old Registration Act, introducing online property registration and mandating the registration of key documents. This initiative aims to modernize the registration process through electronic certificates, digital record maintenance, and Aadhaar-based authentication to reduce fraud and enhance information flow efficiency.

title: IMD sticks to forecast of above-normal monsoon
content: The IMD has updated its monsoon forecast, predicting 'above normal' rainfall for India, with 106% of the long period average. Most regions, including the monsoon core zone, are expected to receive above-normal rainfall, benefiting agriculture. June is also likely to be wetter than usual, potentially reducing heat wave days, though some southern and northeastern areas may see less rain.

title: Gateway jetty is good, SC says, refuses to intervene
content: The Supreme Court declined to halt construction of a passenger jetty and terminal near the Gateway of India, as the Bombay High Court is already reviewing the matter and scheduled to hear it on June 16. The court acknowledged the project's potential benefits for the city, similar to the coastal road.

title: After SC sacked 24,000 school staffers, West Bengal opens job window
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee announced a major school recruitment drive to fill 24,203 vacancies resulting from court rulings. Starting May 30, the process includes age relaxation and experience advantages for applicants. An additional 20,000 teaching positions will also be created.

title: At 50 ft for 3 hours: Chennai roller coaster malfunctions with 30 onboard
content: A roller coaster malfunctioned at an Injambakkam amusement park. Thirty individuals, including children and women, were trapped mid-air. Fire and rescue personnel successfully rescued everyone after a three-hour operation. Preliminary investigations suggest improper maintenance caused the incident. Police have initiated a case and are investigating the park's safety practices. No serious injuries were reported among those rescued.

title: Ghulam Nabi Azad, in Saudi for all-party MPs tour, hospitalised in Riyadh
content: Ghulam Nabi Azad, a former Union minister and part of an all-party MP delegation, was hospitalized in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, during their tour. Baijayant Jay Panda, the delegation leader, confirmed Azad's stable condition and ongoing medical supervision. The delegation will proceed to Algeria, missing Azad's presence as they engage with dignitaries and the Indian community.

title: Annoyed! Anushka Sharma can't hide disappointment as Virat Kohli walks back
content: Virat Kohli achieved his 63rd IPL fifty against Lucknow Super Giants in 2025, surpassing David Warner for the most half-centuries in IPL history. Rishabh Pant's explosive, unbeaten 118 propelled LSG to a massive 227. Despite Kohli's milestone and a strong start, RCB faltered after his dismissal, leaving Anushka Sharma visibly disappointed as the team struggled to chase the target.

title: Trump admin moves to cut $100 m in federal contracts for Harvard
content: The Trump administration is seeking to cancel approximately $100 million in the federal contracts with Harvard University, escalating its conflict with the institution. This action follows the cancellation of over $2.6 billion in research grants and is outlined in a draft letter from the General Services Administration. President Trump has criticized Harvard, alleging liberalism and antisemitism.

title: Rishabh Pant slams ton without Sanjiv Goenka watching
content: Rishabh Pant's explosive, unbeaten century (118* off 61) and Mitchell Marsh's powerful 67 propelled Lucknow Super Giants to a formidable 227/3 against Royal Challengers Bengaluru. Pant, after a period of patchy form, rediscovered his rhythm, smashing 11 fours and 8 sixes, while Marsh continued his impressive run-scoring. Their game-changing 152-run partnership set the stage for LSG's imposing total.

title: Bueckers, back in Connecticut, wins 1st with Wings
content: WNBA pick Paige Bueckers scored 21 points to go with 7 assists and 5 rebounds . the no. 1 pick in the draft by the Dallas Wings had lost her first four games as a pro . it's been a week of homecomings for the former UConn star .

title: PGA Tour axes Tour Championship staggered start
content: the PGA Tour is eliminating the controversial starting-strokes format from the Tour Championship . all 30 players in the field will start at even par in a stroke-play tournament . the winner after 72 holes will capture the FedEx Cup and collect a bonus and five-year PGA tour exemption .
